alert.note: Alert for Northern Lake County; Orange; Osceola; Southern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 26 at 4:57AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Locally Dense Fog Over Lake County Will Spread into Western Orange and Northwestern Osceola Counties... At 500 AM, satellite imagery and traffic cameras showed locally dense fog over central and southern Lake County continuing to spread southeast. The leading edge of the fog appeared to be from Leesburg to Montverde, Clermont and the Green Swamp area. Through sunrise, the fog is expected to continue to spread southeast into western Orange and northwestern Osceola Counties from around Apopka to the Four Corners and greater Kissimmee area. The fog is expected to linger past sunrise, eventually burning by 9 or 10 AM. If you will be out driving early this morning, prepare to encounter rapid reductions in visibility due to dense fog. When driving in dense fog, slow down, use your low beam headlights, and leave plenty of driving distance between your car and the one in front of you.

area.areaDesc: Northern Lake County; Orange; Osceola; Southern Lake County
